interpretation.high: >4.0 may indicate PCOS or high ovarian reserve

clinical_notes: AMH is relatively stable throughout menstrual cycle
Can be tested on any day
PCOS patients typically have elevated AMH
AMH alone doesn't predict fertility - must consider age, FSH, AFC

pcos.description: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome - common endocrine disorder
pcos.diagnosis_criteria: Rotterdam criteria: 2 of 3 - irregular cycles, hyperandrogenism, polycystic ovaries
fertility_impact: Most common cause of anovulatory infertility
Can still conceive naturally with cycle regulation
First-line treatment: letrozole or clomiphene citrate
Lifestyle modification can restore ovulation in 30-50% of cases
pcos.amh_relationship: PCOS patients often have AMH >4-5 ng/mL due to follicle accumulation

fsh_levels.description: Follicle Stimulating Hormone - measured on cycle day 2-3
clinical_notes: Must be measured early follicular phase (day 2-3)
Elevated FSH suggests ovaries need more stimulation
Single high FSH can predict poor IVF response
Combine with AMH and AFC for complete assessment

ovulation_signs: Cervical mucus becomes clear, stretchy (egg-white consistency)
Mild ovulation pain (mittelschmerz) in some women
cycle_tracking.fertile_window: 5 days before ovulation + day of ovulation
timing_recommendations: Intercourse every 1-2 days during fertile window optimal
Daily intercourse doesn't significantly improve odds
OPKs (LH tests) most accurate for predicting ovulation
